ygData.subject: RE: SBLive crashes (OT) Sound Problems in general
ygData.msgSnippet: i get the a3d screen dean...ill check and see if i hear any sounds as much as i play i cant remember right now...heheh ... From: Kimes, Dean W.
ygData.messageBody:
i get the a3d screen dean...ill check and see if i hear any sounds as much
as i play i cant remember right now...heheh

-----Original Message-----
From: Kimes, Dean W. [mailto:Dean_Kimes@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 01, 2000 3:57 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] SBLive crashes (OT) Sound Problems in general


From: "Kimes, Dean W." <Dean_Kimes@...>

My bar is all the way to the right now, I'll try moving it tonite and see if
I get a message. I never did before, but knowing Verant its the message
that activates the sound support.

Kit

thanks, no one at Verant ever indicated there was a message to even look for
and I've talked to at least 10 techies there. Do the rest of you A3d users
get the A3d screen whenever you load up at startup?



-----Original Message-----
From: kim@... [mailto:kim@...]
Sent: Tuesday, February 01, 2000 1:55 PM
To: 'eqbards@onelist.com'
Subject: RE: [eqbards] SBLive crashes (OT) Sound Problems in general


From: kim@...

On Tue, 1 Feb 2000, Kimes, Dean W. wrote:
>
> Sigh. Every time I hear something like this it reminds me how little
> support you get from Verant. I have an A3d card which Verant claims is
> supported. However, I do not hear the sounds mobs make outside of combat.
> That's right, no howling wolves, no chittering beetles, and more
importantly
> no stomping giants. Every giant in the game can sneak right up on me and
> [...]
> I have is not only supported, but tested to work as well? Anybody else
have
> these problems? Another guildmate of mine has a different A3d card and it
> works fine. His is from a secondary manufacturer and mine is from A3d.
> You'd think he would be the one with the problem?

Go to Options, select Sound, and bump up the sound effects
slider until you get a message saying "3D sound enabled."

Yes, that's all there is to it.

--
John H. Kim
kim@...
